snippet: Frustrated by stalled negotiations, the parents of an Army sergeant abruptly disclosed that he was the subject of secret negotiations.
abstract: Parents of Army Sgt Bowe Bergdahl, only American soldier held captive by Afghan insurgents, abruptly disclose that he is a focus of secret negotiations between the Obama administration and the Taliban over a proposed prisoner exchange; negotiations, currently stalled, involve a trade of five Taliban prisoners held at the American military prison at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, for Bergdahl, who was captured in 2009.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller reported from Hailey, Idaho, and Matthew Rosenberg from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Frustrated by stalled negotiations, the parents of an Army sergeant abruptly disclosed that he was the subject of secret negotiations.

headline.seo: P.O.W. Is Focus of Talks on Taliban Prisoner Swap
headline.main: Parents of P.O.W. Reveal U.S. Talks on Taliban Swap
headline.print_headline: Parents of P.O.W. Reveal U.S. Talks on Taliban Deal

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
